Let's not forget that the opposing play can also, at the same time, predict it early too and destroy it.

If you don't have an actual mental disorder, that move is the easiest and most obvious thing in the game to dodge. Plus, GP's entire kit gives him incentive to land them perfectly, and punishes him if he doesn't. If he killed the barrel with a Q, he generates the bonus gold from the Q and the Silver Serpents (which his Q gives him for killing things with it; it's used for upgrading his ultimate) for everything the barrel kills. The barrel also gets 40% armor penetration and will crit if the auto (or Q) that popped it crits. It also spreads Tri Force damage all over its range.

Here's a few tips for playing VS a GP:

1: Pick someone ranged or mobile. Someone who can jump on him or someone who can farm from far enough away from their own minions to force him to pick one: a potential hit on you, or a guaranteed hit on the wave.

2: Watch any barrels you can see. They tick down from 3 health to 1 over the course of a few seconds and, if you can time it right, you can actually kill the barrels as they tick down. If he places one too far away from you for you to kill it, don't stop moving. Miss CS if you have to, but keep moving from side to side until either you get in on that barrel and kill it or it's gone.

3: Watch Gangplank. One common lane tactic for him is to put barrels in brush, let them tick down, and then surprise his opponent with a double or triple barrel combo. However, when he places the barrel, an animation triggers. If you see the animation, you can usually guess which bush he put it in and position yourself away from it enough that he either has to run at you (which is super obvious and you can just walk away) or that he straight out can't reach you with the barrels.
